title: Fort Sumter National Monument: Education
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education             Education         Students posing before riding the boat to Fort Sumter. NPS Photo/Photogenic  Fort Sumter: See where the Civil War began  Bring your students to Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie where they can experience the power of history. Whether you bring your class to the forts or just visit us online, here are some resources to help you bring history to life.         Students help raise the U.S. Flag at Fort Sumter NPS Photo  Plan a Field Trip Fort Sumter National Monument consists of two fortifications: Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie. Your class can visit one or both sites. In this section, you will find information to help your coordinate a field trip to Fort Sumter or plant a visit to Fort Moultrie.               Young Visitor showing off his Junior Ranger badge on Junior Range Day 2016 NPS photo  Become a Junior Ranger We are always looking for new recruits to be Junior Rangers at Fort Sumter National Monument. Learn more about this National Park site and become a Junior Ranger.         This trading card shares details of the raising of this 33-star United State Flag over Fort Sumter on Dec. 27 1860. NPS Trading Card  Civil War to Civil Rights Trading Cards Collect all 11 trading cards at Fort Sumter National Monument's three sites (Fort Sumter, Fort Moultrie, and Liberty Square) to learn more about America's journey from the Civil War to Civil Rights.
